answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The symptoms could be due to viral pathology, or autoimmune pathology, anemia, low or high blood pressure, transient ischemic attacks, hormonal changes, diabetes, and thyroid disorders.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: Hi!I really hope someone can help! I am 17, and have been experiencing some odd symptoms.  I was having muscle aches in one leg and sometimes (rarely) that leg would give out and I would fall.  Also some nubness, pins and needles ect. physically tired after little exerciseSo I went to the doctor and they did blood work which came back normal and I was told to come back for more testsThe next day I was EXHAUSTED!  I slept for two days straight and was really weak.  I had trouble getting to the bathroom about ten feet away and had practically no use of my legs!  When I would stand up I would almost faint, tunnel vision, heart pounding ect. and my legs would just give out!Then I got better withing a couple days and after a few more days of a little weakness I was completely symptom free.  I didnt go back to the doctor as told because I felt so good...So I went two or three months feeling great! But then, I got sick again.  This is the first day I have been able to function! I had the same symptoms as the last "episode" except the weakness was a tiny bit less severe (I could get to the bathroom with only a couple breaks.)  but it lasted a whole five days and I am still pretty weak!I will be going back to the doctor soon but I just wanted anyones thoughts on what could be wrong?
title: Anyone have an idea?
